fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Climate Action
head_office_address: 9 Stortford Hall Industrial Park Dunmow Road
eu_initiatives:
We have been involved in public consultations but was not eligible to participate in the SUP and Plastic Strategy. The industry was excluded since different materials were classified as one item. 
 
We aim to participate in the Single Use Plastics proposed directive between the European Commission, ENVI and the European Parliament.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
EBPC is a member of CEN and Toy Industries of Europe. 
 
Our members are also participate in TC52, WG's and TG's. At national level, our members have registered their organisations in the following standardisation bodies: DS (Denmark), SFS (Finland), NEN (Netherlands), BSI (UK), PKN (Poland), DIN (Germany), ASI (Austria), UNI (Italy).
goals__remit: Our mission is to create a positive and sustainable environment to grow the industry. We work to help with improving industry standards, education, sustainability, and provide a provide a collective voice for the industry.
relevant_communication:
EBPC have already been in discussions with the European Commission policy makers to discuss industry data, and assisted with providing some indication on the size of the market. 
 
We also made clear the difference between plant based polymers and synthetic polymers. 
 
We have also been involved in declaring our interests of EN71-9, 10 and 11 to CEN.
